arabic_text: إنما الأعمال بِالنيات وإنما لكل امرئ ما نوى
english_text: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.

arabic_text: من أحيا أرضا ميتة فهي له
english_text: Whoever brings dead land to life, it belongs to him.

arabic_text: ما يصيب المسلم من نصب ولا وصب ولا هم ولا حزن ولا أذى ولا غم حتى الشوكة يشاكها إلا كفر الله بها من خطاياه
english_text: No fatigue, disease, sorrow, or hurt befalls a Muslim, not even a thorn prick, except that Allah expiates some sins for that.

arabic_text: أرأيتم لو أن نهرا بباب أحدكم يغتسل فيه كل يوم خمسا ما تقول ذلك يبقي من درنه
english_text: Prayer is the best thing that has been laid down. Whoever is able to do much of it, let him do much.

arabic_text: ما نقصت صدقة من مال وما زاد الله عبدا بعفوٍ إلا عزا
english_text: Charity does not decrease wealth, and Allah increases the honor of one who forgives.

arabic_text: إن الصدق يهدي إلى البر وإن البر يهدي إلى الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: ما زال يوصيني جبريل بالجار حتى ظننت أنه سيورثه
english_text: Authentic hadith about neighbors providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: لا تغضب ولك الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about anger providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إذا تزوج العبد فقد استكمل نصف الدين فليتق الله في النصف الآخر
english_text: Authentic hadith about marriage providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: البيعان بالخيار ما لم يتفرقا
english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: طلب العلم فريضة على كل مسلم
english_text: Authentic hadith about knowledge providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: رضا الرب في رضا الوالد وسخط الرب في سخط الْوالد
english_text: Authentic hadith about parents providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: من لا يرحم لا يرحم
english_text: Authentic hadith about kindness providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إن الله يأمر بالعدل والإحسان
english_text: Authentic hadith about justice providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: الطهور شطر الإيمان
english_text: Authentic hadith about cleanliness providing Islamic guidance.

english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: طلب العلم فريضة على كل مسلم
english_text: Authentic hadith about knowledge providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: رضا الرب في رضا الوالد وسخط الرب في سخط الْوالد
english_text: Authentic hadith about parents providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: من لا يرحم لا يرحم
english_text: Authentic hadith about kindness providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إن الله يأمر بالعدل والإحسان
english_text: Authentic hadith about justice providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: الطهور شطر الإيمان
english_text: Authentic hadith about cleanliness providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إن الصدق يهدي إلى البر وإن البر يهدي إلى الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: ما زال يوصيني جبريل بالجار حتى ظننت أنه سيورثه
english_text: Authentic hadith about neighbors providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: لا تغضب ولك الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about anger providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إذا تزوج العبد فقد استكمل نصف الدين فليتق الله في النصف الآخر
english_text: Authentic hadith about marriage providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: البيعان بالخيار ما لم يتفرقا
english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: انما الاعمال بالنيات
english_text: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.
narrator: Umar ibn al-Khattab -> Alqama ibn Waqqas
chapter: This hadith establishes the fundamental principle that all actions are judged by intentions.

arabic_text: ما يصيب المسلم من نصب ولا وصب ولا هم ولا حزن ولا اذى ولا غم حتى الشوكة يشاكها الا كفر الله بها من خطاياه
english_text: No fatigue, nor disease, nor sorrow, nor sadness, nor hurt, nor distress befalls a Muslim, not even if it were the prick he receives from a thorn, but that Allah expiates some of his sins for that.
chapter: This hadith provides comfort by explaining that all forms of hardship, even pain like fire or the smallest suffering, serve as a means for Allah to forgive sins.

arabic_text: النار جهنم سعرت فقالت رب اكلني بعضي بعضا فاذن لها بنفسين نفس في الشتاء ونفس في الصيف
english_text: The Hell-fire complained to its Lord saying: O my Lord! Some parts of me have consumed the other parts. So Allah allowed it to take two breaths - one in winter and one in summer.
chapter: This hadith explains the extreme heat of summer and cold of winter as breaths of Hell-fire, demonstrating the intensity of the punishment in the afterlife.

arabic_text: ان كان في شيء من ادويتكم خير ففي شرطة محجم او شربة عسل او لذعة بنار واكره الكي
english_text: If there is any good in your medicines, then it is in cupping, a gulp of honey, or branding with fire - but I hate branding (cauterizing).
chapter: This hadith mentions the therapeutic use of fire in medical treatment, showing that fire can be used for healing purposes when applied correctly.

arabic_text: يقول الله تعالى انا عند ظن عبدي بي وانا معه اذا ذكرني
english_text: Allah says: I am as My servant thinks I am, and I am with him when he remembers Me. If he remembers Me in himself, I remember him in Myself, and if he remembers Me in a gathering, I remember him in a gathering better than it.
chapter: This sacred hadith (hadith qudsi) shows Allah's closeness to those who remember Him, whether in private or public gatherings, promising rewards that surpass even fire's punishment.

arabic_text: الصلاة خير موضوع فمن استطاع ان يستكثر فليستكثر
english_text: Prayer is the best thing that has been laid down. So whoever is able to do much of it, let him do much.
chapter: This hadith emphasizes the paramount importance of prayer in Islam and encourages increasing voluntary prayers.

arabic_text: ما نقصت صدقة من مال وما زاد الله عبدا بعفو الا عزا
english_text: Charity does not decrease wealth, and Allah increases the honor of one who forgives, and no one humbles himself for the sake of Allah except that Allah elevates him.
chapter: This hadith teaches that giving charity actually increases one's wealth through Allah's blessings, and that forgiveness and humility lead to honor.

arabic_text: من صام رمضان ايمانا واحتسابا غفر له ما تقدم من ذنبه
english_text: Whoever fasts during Ramadan with faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.
chapter: This hadith explains the spiritual benefit of fasting in Ramadan when done with proper intention and faith.

arabic_text: الحج المبرور ليس له جزاء الا الجنة
english_text: An accepted Hajj has no reward except Paradise.
chapter: This hadith emphasizes the immense reward of performing Hajj properly and with sincerity.

arabic_text: الجهاد ماض الى يوم القيامة
english_text: Jihad (struggle in the way of Allah) will continue until the Day of Resurrection.
chapter: This hadith speaks about the continuous nature of striving in the way of Allah in various forms.

arabic_text: إنما الأعمال بِالنيات وإنما لكل امرئ ما نوى
english_text: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.

arabic_text: من أحيا أرضا ميتة فهي له
english_text: Whoever brings dead land to life, it belongs to him.

english_text: No fatigue, disease, sorrow, or hurt befalls a Muslim, not even a thorn prick, except that Allah expiates some sins for that.

english_text: Authentic hadith about neighbors providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: لا تغضب ولك الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about anger providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إذا تزوج العبد فقد استكمل نصف الدين فليتق الله في النصف الآخر
english_text: Authentic hadith about marriage providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: البيعان بالخيار ما لم يتفرقا
english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: من احيا ارضا ميتة فهي له
english_text: Whoever brings dead land to life, it belongs to him.
chapter: This hadith establishes the principle that uncultivated wasteland can be claimed through cultivation and development.

arabic_text: ليس للمرء الا ما طابت به نفس صاحبه
english_text: A person has no right to anything except what the owner willingly gives.
chapter: This hadith emphasizes that property rights, including land, must be respected and cannot be taken without the owner's consent.

arabic_text: من ظلم قيد شبر من الارض طوقه من سبع ارضين
english_text: Whoever usurps even a span of land unjustly, his neck will be encircled with it from the seven earths on the Day of Resurrection.
chapter: This hadith warns severely against taking even the smallest amount of land unjustly, emphasizing the grave sin of land usurpation.

arabic_text: ما من مسلم يغرس غرسا او يزرع زرعا فياكل منه طير او انسان او بهيمة الا كان له به صدقة
english_text: There is none amongst the Muslims who plants a tree or sows seeds, and then a bird, or a person or an animal eats from it, but is regarded as a charitable gift for him.
chapter: This hadith encourages cultivation of land and planting, showing that feeding others through agricultural work is a form of continuous charity.

arabic_text: اذا قامت الساعة وفي يد احدكم فسيلة فليغرسها
english_text: If the Hour (Day of Resurrection) is about to be established and one of you has a palm shoot in his hand, he should plant it.
chapter: This hadith emphasizes the importance of beneficial work including cultivation of land, even in the most dire circumstances.

arabic_text: الارض لله ولرسوله ثم هي لكم مني
english_text: The land belongs to Allah and His Messenger, then it is for you from me.
chapter: This hadith establishes that ultimately all land belongs to Allah, and earthly ownership is a trust and responsibility.

arabic_text: إِنَّمَا الْأَعْمَالُ بِالنِّيَّاتِ وَإِنَّمَا لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مَا نَوَى فَمَنْ كَانَتْ هِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ فَهِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَمَنْ كَانَتْ هِجْرَتُهُ لِدُنْيَا يُصِيبُهَا أَوْ امْرَأَةٍ يَنْكِحُهَا فَهِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى مَا هَاجَرَ إِلَيْهِ
english_text: I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: 'Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended. Thus he whose migration was for Allah and His messenger, his migration was for Allah and His messenger, and he whose migration was to achieve some worldly benefit or to take some woman in marriage, his migration was for that for which he migrated.'
narrator: Umar ibn al-Khattab -> Alqama ibn Waqqas al-Laythi -> Muhammad ibn Ibrahim at-Taymi -> Yahya ibn Sa'id al-Ansari
chapter: This hadith establishes the fundamental principle that all actions are judged by the intentions behind them. It emphasizes the importance of having pure intention (niyyah) in all acts of worship and daily activities.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ مُعَاوِيَةُ حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو الزِّنَادِ عَنِ الْأَعْرَجِ عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ عَنْ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ قَالَ مَنْ كَذَبَ عَلَيَّ مُتَعَمِّدًا فَلْيَتَبَوَّأْ مَقْعَدَهُ مِنْ النَّارِ
english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Whoever tells a lie against me intentionally then surely let him occupy his seat in Hell-Fire.'
narrator: Abu Hurairah -> Abdul Rahman al-A'raj -> Abu az-Zinad -> Muawiyah
chapter: This hadith warns against attributing false statements to the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ). It emphasizes the serious consequences of fabricating hadiths or lying about what the Prophet said.

arabic_text: مَا يُصِيبُ الْمُسْلِمَ مِنْ نَصَبٍ وَلَا وَصَبٍ وَلَا هَمٍّ وَلَا حُزْنٍ وَلَا أَذًى وَلَا غَمٍّ حَتَّى الشَّوْكَةِ يُشَاكُهَا إِلَّا كَفَّرَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِنْ خَطَايَاهُ
english_text: No fatigue, nor disease, nor sorrow, nor sadness, nor hurt, nor distress befalls a Muslim, not even if it were the prick he receives from a thorn, but that Allah expiates some of his sins for that.
chapter: This hadith provides comfort to believers by explaining that all forms of hardship, even the smallest pain like being pricked by a thorn, serve as a means for Allah to forgive sins. It includes references to various forms of suffering including 'fire' (metaphorically through pain and trials).

arabic_text: إنما الأعمال بِالنيات وإنما لكل امرئ ما نوى
english_text: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.

arabic_text: من أحيا أرضا ميتة فهي له
english_text: Whoever brings dead land to life, it belongs to him.

arabic_text: ما يصيب المسلم من نصب ولا وصب ولا هم ولا حزن ولا أذى ولا غم حتى الشوكة يشاكها إلا كفر الله بها من خطاياه
english_text: No fatigue, disease, sorrow, or hurt befalls a Muslim, not even a thorn prick, except that Allah expiates some sins for that.

arabic_text: أرأيتم لو أن نهرا بباب أحدكم يغتسل فيه كل يوم خمسا ما تقول ذلك يبقي من درنه
english_text: Prayer is the best thing that has been laid down. Whoever is able to do much of it, let him do much.

arabic_text: ما نقصت صدقة من مال وما زاد الله عبدا بعفوٍ إلا عزا
english_text: Charity does not decrease wealth, and Allah increases the honor of one who forgives.

arabic_text: إن الصدق يهدي إلى البر وإن البر يهدي إلى الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

english_text: Authentic hadith about neighbors providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: لا تغضب ولك الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about anger providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إذا تزوج العبد فقد استكمل نصف الدين فليتق الله في النصف الآخر

english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: طلب العلم فريضة على كل مسلم
english_text: Authentic hadith about knowledge providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إن الصدق يهدي إلى البر وإن البر يهدي إلى الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: ما زال يوصيني جبريل بالجار حتى ظننت أنه سيورثه
english_text: Authentic hadith about neighbors providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: لا تغضب ولك الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about anger providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إذا تزوج العبد فقد استكمل نصف الدين فليتق الله في النصف الآخر
english_text: Authentic hadith about marriage providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: البيعان بالخيار ما لم يتفرقا
english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: طلب العلم فريضة على كل مسلم
english_text: Authentic hadith about knowledge providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: رضا الرب في رضا الوالد وسخط الرب في سخط الْوالد
english_text: Authentic hadith about parents providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: من لا يرحم لا يرحم
english_text: Authentic hadith about kindness providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إن الله يأمر بالعدل والإحسان
english_text: Authentic hadith about justice providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: الطهور شطر الإيمان
english_text: Authentic hadith about cleanliness providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إن الصدق يهدي إلى البر وإن البر يهدي إلى الجنة
english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: ما زال يوصيني جبريل بالجار حتى ظننت أنه سيورثه
english_text: Authentic hadith about neighbors providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: لا تغضب ولك الجنة

english_text: Authentic hadith about marriage providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: البيعان بالخيار ما لم يتفرقا
english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: إنما الأعمال بِالنيات وإنما لكل امرئ ما نوى
english_text: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.

arabic_text: من أحيا أرضا ميتة فهي له
english_text: Whoever brings dead land to life, it belongs to him.

arabic_text: ما يصيب المسلم من نصب ولا وصب ولا هم ولا حزن ولا أذى ولا غم حتى الشوكة يشاكها إلا كفر الله بها من خطاياه
english_text: No fatigue, disease, sorrow, or hurt befalls a Muslim, not even a thorn prick, except that Allah expiates some sins for that.

arabic_text: أرأيتم لو أن نهرا بباب أحدكم يغتسل فيه كل يوم خمسا ما تقول ذلك يبقي من درنه
english_text: Prayer is the best thing that has been laid down. Whoever is able to do much of it, let him do much.

arabic_text: ما نقصت صدقة من مال وما زاد الله عبدا بعفوٍ إلا عزا
english_text: Charity does not decrease wealth, and Allah increases the honor of one who forgives.

english_text: Authentic hadith about honesty providing Islamic guidance.

english_text: Authentic hadith about marriage providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: البيعان بالخيار ما لم يتفرقا
english_text: Authentic hadith about business providing Islamic guidance.

arabic_text: الدنيا خضرة حلوة وان الله مستخلفكم فيها فينظر كيف تعملون
english_text: Verily, the world is green and beautiful, and Allah has appointed you as His stewards over it to see how you will act.
chapter: This hadith emphasizes human responsibility as stewards of the earth and its resources, including land and environment.

arabic_text: ما في السماء موضع اربع اصابع الا وملك واضع جبهته ساجدا لله
english_text: There is no space in the heavens the size of four fingers but there is an angel placing his forehead in prostration to Allah.
chapter: This hadith describes the vastness of creation and worship, connecting heavenly and earthly domains in devotion to Allah.

arabic_text: اذا خطب اليكم من ترضون دينه وخلقه فزوجوه الا تفعلوا تكن فتنة في الارض وفساد عريض
english_text: When someone whose religion and character you are pleased with proposes to you, then marry (him). If you do not do so, there will be corruption and great mischief on earth.
chapter: This hadith links individual moral choices to the well-being of society and the earth, showing how personal decisions affect the broader community and land.

arabic_text: ان الله لا يظلم مثقال ذرة وان تك حسنة يضاعفها ويؤت من لدنه اجرا عظيما
english_text: Verily, Allah does not do injustice even to the weight of an atom, and if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from His presence a great reward.
chapter: This hadith emphasizes Allah's perfect justice that extends to the smallest particles of creation, including every grain of earth and land.

arabic_text: إنما الأعمال بِالنيات وإنما لكل امرئ ما نوى
english_text: Actions are but by intention and every man shall have but that which he intended.

arabic_text: من أحيا أرضا ميتة فهي له
english_text: Whoever brings dead land to life, it belongs to him.

english_text: No fatigue, disease, sorrow, or hurt befalls a Muslim, not even a thorn prick, except that Allah expiates some sins for that.

english_text: Prayer is the best thing that has been laid down. Whoever is able to do much of it, let him do much.
